result.reason: Floating tabs/panels undock at a tiny default size, causing RDP sessions to shrink and frustrating users repeatedly
result.approach: When a ConnectionWindow transitions to DockState.Float, set the FloatWindow size to a reasonable default (e.g., 75% of the primary screen or match the previous docked size) instead of the DockPanelSuite small default

attempts.raw_output:
Based on the issue and code analysis, this is a UX enhancement request about floating/undocked tabs defaulting to a small size, causing RDP sessions to shrink. The fix would involve setting sensible default dimensions when a panel is first undocked to float state, likely in `ConnectionWindow.cs` where `DockState.Float` is handled, and potentially in the DockPanel library's float window creation.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"Floating tabs/panels undock at a tiny default size, causing RDP sessions to shrink and frustrating users repeatedly","priority":"P3-enhancement","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ConnectionWindow.cs"],"approach":"When a ConnectionWindow transitions to DockState.Float, set the FloatWindow size to a reasonable default (e.g., 75% of the primary screen or match the previous docked size) instead of the DockPanelSuite small default"}
```
